channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Can Faith Kipyegon break four minutes in the mile? Scientists say yes.
item.description: Faith Kipyegon, the fastest female miler in the world, could dip under 4 minutes with an extra boost from pacers.
item.content:encoded:
Faith Kipyegon, the fastest female miler in the world, could dip under 4 minutes with an extra boost from pacers.

(Image credit: Michael Steele)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: How to watch the Oscars on Sunday night
item.description: The 97th Academy Awards will air on ABC and stream on Hulu at 7 p.m. ET. Comedian and actor Conan O'Brien is hosting and Wicked stars Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo will perform.
item.content:encoded:
The 97th Academy Awards will air on ABC and stream on Hulu at 7 p.m. ET. Comedian and actor Conan O'Brien is hosting and Wicked stars Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo will perform.

(Image credit: Kevin Winter)
item.dc:creator: Dhanika Pineda

item.title: Trump will address Congress. Why isn't this first speech called a State of the Union?
item.description: Trump will give his first speech to Congress next Tuesday since his reelection. It has characteristics of what Americans call a State of the Union address, but it's not officially designated as such.
item.content:encoded:
Trump will give his first speech to Congress next Tuesday since his reelection. It has characteristics of what Americans call a State of the Union address, but it's not officially designated as such.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Hamas rejects Israel's request to extend phase one of Gaza ceasefire
item.description: Hamas says it is not willing to extend the first phase of the Gaza ceasefire, rejecting an Israeli request to delay negotiations on the second phase.
item.content:encoded:
Hamas says it is not willing to extend the first phase of the Gaza ceasefire, rejecting an Israeli request to delay negotiations on the second phase.

(Image credit: Youssef Alzanoun)
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: In the federal court system, law clerks find little recourse for bullying and abuse
item.description: An NPR investigation finds federal judges have enormous influence with few checks on their power. Law clerks and other judicial employees are vulnerable to mistreatment and have few job protections.
item.content:encoded:
An NPR investigation finds federal judges have enormous influence with few checks on their power. Law clerks and other judicial employees are vulnerable to mistreatment and have few job protections.

(Image credit: Isabel Seliger for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Voice of America bias inquiry sparks concerns of political meddling
item.description: Voice of America is reviewing the social media posts of a reporter for possible bias against the Trump Administration. The review is sparking concerns of political meddling.
item.content:encoded:
Voice of America is reviewing the social media posts of a reporter for possible bias against the Trump Administration. The review is sparking concerns of political meddling.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: DOGE's savings page fixed old mistakes â€” and added new ones
item.description: An NPR review of new data added to DOGE's "wall of receipts" finds the group quietly changed previous errors, added new ones and still has little verified savings to show for its work.
item.content:encoded:
An NPR review of new data added to DOGE's "wall of receipts" finds the group quietly changed previous errors, added new ones and still has little verified savings to show for its work.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Federal workers get a new email demanding their accomplishments
item.description: Federal employees have received a second email from the Office of Personnel Management asking them what they did last week.
item.content:encoded:
Federal employees have received a second email from the Office of Personnel Management asking them what they did last week.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Says She's Fighting President Trump's "Illusion of Power"
item.description:
Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, a New York Democrat, says she thinks Republicans have begun making mistakes... and her party is resolved to strike back.

Want more comprehensive analysis of the most important news of the day, plus a little fun? Subscribe to the Up First newsletter.

This bonus episode of Up First was edited by Susan Davis, Kelsey Snell and Reena Advani. It was produced by Adam Bearne. We get engineering support from Neil Tevault and Hannah Gluvna. Our Executive Producer is Kelley Dickens.
item.content:encoded:
Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, a New York Democrat, says she thinks Republicans have begun making mistakes... and her party is resolved to strike back.

Want more comprehensive analysis of the most important news of the day, plus a little fun? Subscribe to the Up First newsletter.

This bonus episode of Up First was edited by Susan Davis, Kelsey Snell and Reena Advani. It was produced by Adam Bearne. We get engineering support from Neil Tevault and Hannah Gluvna. Our Executive Producer is Kelley Dickens.

item.title: Gene Hackman's pacemaker activity suggests he died several days before he was found
item.description: Hackman's pacemaker was last active on Feb. 17, according to the Santa Fe County Sheriff Adan Mendoza. He said Friday it is "a very good assumption" that was his death date.
item.content:encoded:
Hackman's pacemaker was last active on Feb. 17, according to the Santa Fe County Sheriff Adan Mendoza. He said Friday it is "a very good assumption" that was his death date.

(Image credit: Donaldson Collection)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
